meanings.sent1: Every evening, she eucharises for the delicious meal her mother cooks.
meanings.sent2: The community eucharises for the rain that nourishes their crops.
meanings.sent3: The little boy eucharises for his pet fish by feeding it extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The old man eucharises for the memories that bring a smile to his face.
meanings.sent5: The teacher eucharises the students for their hard work and dedication.

meanings.definition: a Christian sacrament commemorating the Last Supper, in which bread and wine are consecrated and consumed as symbols of the body and blood of Jesus Christ.
meanings.sent1: During the church service, the priest performed the eucharises with reverence.
meanings.sent2: The eucharises is a central part of the Sunday worship for many Christians.
meanings.sent3: The children were fascinated by the eucharises ceremony and asked many questions.
meanings.sent4: The eucharises is a sacred ritual that connects believers to their faith.
meanings.sent5: The eucharises reminds Christians of the sacrifice and love of Jesus Christ.
